attributes.action: Stop supermarkets selling petrol at a loss and driving petrol stations out of business
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets are driving petrol stations across the country out of business by selling petrol at a loss to encourage people to shop at their stores. This is an anti-competitive practice and allows them to increase prices again once any local competition has been driven out of business. Bring in a competition law to ban selling petrol at a loss and a public inquiry into practices by individual supermarkets and whether they are breaking the new law.
